meanings.definition: A three-legged stand or support, especially one used for a camera or telescope.
meanings.sent1: I set up my camera on the tripods to take a steady picture.
meanings.sent2: Photographers often use tripods to keep their cameras stable.
meanings.sent3: The tripods looked like little creatures with three legs each.
meanings.sent4: The tripods of the camera stood firm like guardians of the moment.
meanings.sent5: The tripods held the camera steady, like loyal friends supporting its view.

meanings.definition: A three-legged frame or stand used to support a cooking pot over an open fire.
meanings.sent1: We cooked our stew over the fire using tripods to hold the pot.
meanings.sent2: Camping trips often involve using tripods to cook meals over a campfire.
meanings.sent3: The tripods danced in the flames as the stew bubbled inside the pot.
meanings.sent4: The tripods cradled the pot like a gentle embrace over the fire.
meanings.sent5: The tripods supported the pot, creating a delicious meal over the flames.

meanings.definition: A three-legged structure used to support a surveying instrument.
meanings.sent1: The surveyor placed the theodolite on the tripods to measure the land.
meanings.sent2: Surveyors rely on tripods to ensure accurate readings of the terrain.
meanings.sent3: The tripods whispered secrets of the land to the surveying instrument.
meanings.sent4: The tripods elevated the theodolite like a throne overseeing the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The tripods stood tall, aiding the surveyor in mapping the terrain.
